utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, I'm participant number thirteen and my name is Mirelle- Nery.

utterances.transcript: This- Could you just spell it?

utterances.transcript: Oh can I spell my name to you?

utterances.transcript: It's M I R E L L E.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: J E A N N E. Hi Mirelle.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And how are you doing today?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I would like to visit Singapore with my nephew.

utterances.transcript: %Uh may I know your age range please?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: He is twenty four years old.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I was still a little boy.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It will be my graduation gift to him because he graduated in college.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And I would like to like bring him to Singapore to- for a short tour.

utterances.transcript: %Uh when are you thinking of coming?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh we plan to leave for Singapore on April fifth until April seventh.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think there are lots of flights.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh first I would like to bring him to Universal Studios and on- or maybe some historical places still in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Can you sug- gest where should we visit?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You want historical places but you also want Universal Studios, huh?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I'm going to get into the website of Universal Studios first.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do you know how much is the entrance fee- for Universal?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do you know how much is it?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me get into the website.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: When did it open in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: When did Universal Studios open in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do you know by any chance?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think about two years or so.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Have you ever been to- have you ever been to Universal Studios?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I'm not one for rides and things like that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Actually I went there before they opened.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We visited the beautiful hotels there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh did you like- did you like it though?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They are very luxurious and comfortable- and within walking distance of the %um theatre and- you're on an island, on Sentosa island.

utterances.transcript: Wow, in-right on an island rather, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you could spend your time there- %uh enjoying the sites on the island, besides Universal Studios.

utterances.transcript: Is it expensive or is it okay?

utterances.transcript: %Uh let me get the package for you, okay?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no. But I have a bunch of nephews and nieces that I take out occasionally.

utterances.transcript: So you're also very close to your nephews and nieces?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No, actually my nephews and nieces are old.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But %uh- it's their children so I'm a grandaunt now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um, I'm trying to get the package to appear.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: 'Cause when you buy the package then you will get %uh-

utterances.transcript: It's like the package contains everything like the entrance fee, the rides.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, let me get your dates.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Fifth of April to seventh of April, is that right?

utterances.transcript: That's April fifth on- and until April seventh.

utterances.transcript: And there's just two of us who's gonna travel to Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it would be one twin room.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Are you thinking of staying on the island or %uh-

utterances.transcript: %Um, is there a hotel you can recommend which is in- within the city wherein it 's very near all the places that, you know we can also visit?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Well, there are many hotels %uh that are very %uh moderately priced.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And near to the island there are other business class hotels like a hundred over dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But if you want to save the money on- to spend time on sho~ %uh spend the money on shopping and other things then we have the three-star hotels.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh is it nice too even if it's only three storey?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Even only it's a three-star hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh the space is small within the rooms because most of the them are in conservation shophouses.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So anyway, is it near right, transportation and also is it near like convenience store wherein we can go to?

utterances.transcript: %Uh convenience stores and shops and food and you can walk around and soak in the atmosphere.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So the location is very good, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And they're also clean and they are, you know?

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.transcript: %Uh just wear summer clothes, lights, cottons.

utterances.speaker: Guide

utterances.transcript: So you know this is a very high price %uh hotel at five hundred.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, so it's five twenty eight.

utterances.transcript: If you want to look at the hotels let me do hotels first then I will come to the other attractions.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I really appreciate you helping me right go through like places we can go to your beautiful country, Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Why is your country called the Lion City?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: When the- a prince came to Singapore long ago, he saw an animal.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And he was told that far away there is an animal called a singa which is lion.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do you call a lion in Singapore singa?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's how- that's why it's Singapore, you see?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But actually we don't have lions naturally found here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh we have tigers or we once had tigers here in the jungle but not lions.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So he could have seen a tiger.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: He could have seen a wild boar and he was given the wrong information.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So Singapore was called the Lion City, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh, we've stuck with that name.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh maybe it's confusing for people who know their natural history, right?

utterances.transcript: Can you tell me something about your culture?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I mean people in Singapore how are they?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then we have Malays and Indians.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And we also have %uh Eurasians, Europeans, %uh large expatriate of communities.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's very easy to visit Singapore.

utterances.transcript: We were %uh- but archaeological diggings have found that Chinese have been coming here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The Arabs as well to trade.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So- and that dates back long ago.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But %uh in 1819, that's the most recent history a British official in the Far East came here and he brought along free trade.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: He allowed people of different races to settle here, to trade here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And he didn't charge taxes and that's why we became very popular with the people settling here and still today.

utterances.transcript: Ha- I heard Singapore is a very safe city.

utterances.transcript: The crime rate is I think zero to one percent.

utterances.transcript: I don't know the official crime rate but what I know is that you just need to be careful with your belongings and not be a bit careless so that, you know, people don't just help themselves- your things.

utterances.transcript: This is a MegaZip Adventure Park.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, let's go check out the website.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You are brave if you dare to try zip-line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I did paragliding in %uh Thailand and %uh my nieces thought I- I-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I enjoyed it very much %uh except that, you know, the insurance doesn't cover that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, so you really have to be an adventurist to do it.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's awesome, you feel like having one ride after.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So it go- it goes through from what point till what point?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh bungee jump- %Uh it's the top of the hill, I think.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: To the beach if I'm not mistaken.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: All these especially at %uh the big organisers like this, they are very safe.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But what is the most- but what is the most popular spot in Hong~ %uh rather in Singapore that people go to?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Even the- %Uh the youngsters, they do this zip-line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And they also go on their- what do you call it?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's a bit scary for people like me.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh oh there's another one, that's a new one on Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You'll get into a %um oh dear what is it called?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You get into %uh a small building and you have these people help you float in the air.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because the wind is blowing at you at high speed.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh that's- That can be- so scary.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You put on a- %Uh no, you put on a suit.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You put on a protective suit and you wear tennis shoes.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I've done it so it can't be that scary.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: You were able to survive it, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We all survived it so don't worry.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So even here, can you see the harness is- fully fitted.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: How much will it cost me if I go to the zip-line?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me see if they have price.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No. %Um I was at the place where I could have tried it but %uh I chickened out in the end.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because it's too high speed for me.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think you're still very young, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: the zip-line prices are not on.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think %uh it could be- let me see.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um sometimes they organise it for a group and then they have special prices.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I wanna go check out your %um casinos.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well, I like playing the slots.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh you can go into the casinos free of charge because you're a tourist.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: No, where do I go to?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There's another one at Marina Bay Sands.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh you're gonna show me a video.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I don't have the stomach for it.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I don't think I will be able to- cross it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I think it's from the top of the hill to one of the little islands there which is built off-just off the beach.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you're getting a view of the beach at Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yeah, but the site is beautiful.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh what you are hearing is the sound of the wind.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you look at the video, I think that's the sound of the wind.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh just now when you saw the video with all the noise.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That was the sound of the wind- because they are travelling at high speed.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh now we are putting up for you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We have another zip-line at Bedok Reservoir Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Are you getting it on your screen here?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, Forest Adventure or is it MegaZip Adventure Park?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No, Me~MegaZip is what you just saw.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we're gonna- go to Forest Adventure.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh, it can also- oh okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So do you know how much is it?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do you have any idea how much it's gonna cost me if I go to Forest Adventure?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, I'm getting them on the line %uh to see if I can get any prices here.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So there should be advance booking, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because I think they need a minimum %uh okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we have their numbers there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, and it's- yes, eight hundred number.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that will be fine so I can call them.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh so we- I have to choose a date if I'm gonna go to Forest Adventure, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I have to book- ahead of time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because they don't do it for you just for one person.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They need to have a number of people.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you see here- do you see here now?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, oh so it's also by age, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And your weight, you cannot be- too heavy.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh no. I guess I'm not gonna go to- alright.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because I think I will- No, I think- I can.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So you have to book in it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: What- so you like %um %uh you know like Universal Studio, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That and then %um zip-line, some shopping and-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And maybe at least like Little India, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It would be okay, but we only- remember we only have two days so it's gonna be a really hectic schedule.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um, if you are very keen on culture then Little India stay would be good, otherwise- %uh your %uh M Hotel would be good.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh, I have- I have a very good question, Ms. Jeanne. I-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I have a very good question, Ms. Jeanne. I- have a very good question.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then- you see it took- so-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: If I am a tourist visiting Singapore for the first time-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: okay, how many days would you advise me to stay in your country, so I will be able to at least go through a lot of places?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Five days is the ideal, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I'm a relaxed traveller. I like to do things slowly.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, it's very hard if you're pressed for time.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: If you're pressed for time and you only have two days to fit in all the places you would like to visit.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think that will be too stressful.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh then you can go to other attractions, you see?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But if I only have like a budget of maybe right, a thousand dollars, would it get me to a lot of places though?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you may have to downgrade your hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh since you are able to travel by the Mass Rapid Transit, the train system let me get you on the MRT map.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can find that you can get anywhere on it.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I mean not do a lot of shopping maybe.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Maybe I can just buy some souvenir, right, stuff- but not really shop because I mean I don't have a lot of like extra money to bring with me, so I think I can only bring a piece of thousand dollars and that's it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, then- if you spend your time-because when you shop you spend a lot of time.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Instead of that, you can move to places.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I really- Yes, on foot, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because I was thinking like maybe that's a good advice for me for us to downgrade our hotel and then try to like %uh, you know, take MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Do you see the map on your screen?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And- Yes, and don't shop a lot.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Just, you know, just enjoy the place.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Because there's a lot of places that we can- go to in Singapore, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: What should I taste or try in Singapore?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh try all the different kinds of food and %uh if you are used to eating %um you know, adventurous in food, you don't need to sit down at the restaurant.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Then again not only do you save money.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But %uh you get %uh authentic local food and you can intermingle with the locals at the food centres.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But what- which one is your favorite?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Which one do you like eating the best?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Which one do you really like?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I like a very old one.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But first let me finish the map here, okay?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you take down the train down the green line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You just take it to Tanah Merah, can you see it?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Look at number three on your right.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see number three on your right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You would land at Changi Airport.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you just take a short shuttle to Tanah Merah and you take the westbound.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you would be in town.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So depending on where you stay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh if you choose to stay in Little India, you will switch at City Hall to Dhoby Ghaut.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see the red line?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Number eight is a major interchange station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And if you move up to the Little India stop, there you are.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: In Little India-in between Little India and Farrer Park, there are small %uh hotels there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And I think we saw one of them just now, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you move the other way down to Chinatown, there are also many little hotels.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And these hotels are converted shophouses.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's %uh bit of heritage that you're living in.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: good location to- I mean visit, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Visit, yes, then you walk around.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you're in Little India, you visit the Little India area on foot.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you can move by train to Chinatown and visit Chinatown on foot.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And also I can go to Orchard maybe, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's just not really that far.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Orchard then you go connect the- on the-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: you go back to Dhoby Ghaut, which is the major interchange and full of shops there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So in Little India, you try the Indian food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, curry, you can get- you take note of the name, Race Course Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let me see if I can get it for you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are lot of restaurants there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And along Serangoon Road which is the main road %uh in Little India you have many vegetarian restaurants also.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: In fact it's a great place %uh for vegetarians in Little India because many of the Hindus here are vegetarian.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I read some- I read it, right.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That you guys, Singaporean guys, really like going to delis and you also are coffee drinkers, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh once you pay for a cup of coffee you can get a whole %uh vegetarian meal- in Little India.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or Chinese noodles in Chinatown, you know like- three, four dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And- you're okay to go, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: For three to four dollars and you know?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You might need another %uh a second portion if you have a healthy appetite.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh but otherwise, you know %uh it's %uh more than enough.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: For me it's more than enough.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And we have this website called HungryGoWhere.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And Muthu Curries is one of %uh my favourite places.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The area used to be a race course in the days of the British.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm gonna try that because it says here top must try dishes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh I'm gonna try that when I get there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's- You can take chili, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can tell them and maybe they can %uh modify you- modify a bit for you because we have many expatriates here but some of them like it really hot.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The British expatriates %uh love it hot.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And also I- Ms. %uh Jeanne, I also have one question.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Are Singa~ yah, are Singaporeans %uh friendly people?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Are you guys friendly or- I mean can we ask question maybe if we're lost?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Can we approach, you know, just approach you and say, "Excuse me, can you tell us where is-" or can you give us directions?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Are you guys approachable and friendly too?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But you have to do the approaching.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Normally we mind our own business.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you're lost, we expect you to ask us and then we will be very helpful.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But they will maybe not come out and approach you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Although we're trying to change that mindset right now.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So maybe I can say pardon or excuse me, I'm kind of lost, can you give us direction going to like- Orchard place or- okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They would be very helpful and if you get in to any train station %uh the officers there would be very happy to direct you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I was supposed to show you the- I want to just show you this about the %uh okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Train, you see the train map here?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Are you getting the maps or- EZ-Link Card.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: This is a card we carry and I suggest you get it when you come.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Oh so I don't have to like, you know, shell out, change everytime I take the MRT, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's right, you don't have to worry about it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And the best place to get it is at the airport.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, so how- how much is it?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Why am I getting this- pictures?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think they tied up with a lot of people.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh with the EZ-Link Card, you can buy food as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you put in a lot of money- you have to put in money first when you buy the card.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then when you buy the card, you %um get benefits at certain places.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Seve~ Even sell them at Seven Eleven Stores.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Like as I said, if you get it at the airport %uh I think they can supply you with a little map to go with it.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is it- ten dollars, twenty dollars?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see at the bottom of the screen?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So it is like twelve dollars-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Ten dollars and five dollars, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh when you buy it at Seven Eleven stores, they only charge you ten.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: When you buy it at the post office outlets, it's five dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That's a lot of %um discount if I, you know, buy it in SingPost- outlets.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But- No, it's the top-up value.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um you need to put in money on top of this value.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So it's just like a denomination, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So if you think you're gonna travel a lot, you can put in more money.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And when you leave at the airport, leave some time to go back to the office and get your refund.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I can use it and then everytime I use it, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So there will be like-my balance will not be as, you know, like twelve dollars from twelve dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It goes down- to ten, eight seven- until there's not- you know, there is nothing left, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So- %uh normally at the SingPost and Seven Eleven, they think people are just using it as a convenience.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's a bit cheaper, yah, but you can get your balance value so it's not a problem.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So far I have my mind set that I'm gonna take %um a re~ %uh pardon %um moderately-priced hotel.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm gonna go- to Universal Studio.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Go to- Little India and go to along Orchard Road and Rangoon.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh maybe when you do Little India you do Chinatown as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because they're both of the same line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then when you go to %uh Universal Studios and the Forest Adventure you do it on another day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh that's what your two days will allow you to do.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you want more %uh you need to stay about 5 days I think.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Then you need to visit- you can visit attractions like the zoo, the Night Safari, the bird park.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I made up my mind and %um thank you very much for your help.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Now if-do you have any additional, right, information that you want to tell me before- right, I end our call?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Maybe you can- tell me some more attraction in your country.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Oh %ah. %Uh the zoo, the bird park and the night safari are places that tourists normally go to.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And other attractions on Sentosa island.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So it's advisable to stay like five days, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: To be able to enjoy it.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: At least five days I think.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can spend one day shopping also.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: If I still have money left, I have to go into a lot of places we've talked about.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um perhaps I'll go to your country and I think it's a very beautiful country.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And I enjoyed talking to you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And I look seeing you Mirelle.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: If you don't mind, how old- how young are you?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I'm holding a Senior Citizens Travel Pass that's how-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We only get that when we are- I think sixty two or something like that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, I'm serious, but I love young people and I'm interacting with them all the time.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I can't believe it Jeanne Miss Jeanne that you are holding a Senior Citizen Pass.`

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Miss Jeanne that you are holding a Senior Citizen Pass.` No way.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Thank you very much Mirelle, you made my day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And really ma~ really five days is what you need.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Five days maximum to be able to enjoy all the sites and what Singapore, you know, has to offer, right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I guess I'll take five days and I'll call you again.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But I really enjoyed talking to you.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And I learnt about your country.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay, so I'm gonna say goodbye now and I hope to talk to you again soon.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, I do hope to see you Mirelle.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Meet you on the street one day, huh?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Enjoy the rest of today and talk to you later.
